body:
So I was playing some Nebula, and I found this out.
Before the game starts, most likely you will do /join.
But what's weird is you can keep repeating /join, and you'll end up on the other team eventually.
So you can basically pick your team, like donors can. It should be fixed.
I don't know if this happens on other games, but I only found it on Nebula.
http://imgur.com/LB4vcqd
http://imgur.com/F92am7q
Check it out.
~DiamondPorkchop3

title: Please Fix This.

replies.body:
Yes.. Thats because the game hasn't started. You are /joining the other team purposely
It doesn't happen all the time, only when teams are uneven
replies.body_tagged:
Yes.. Thats because the game hasn't started. You are /joining the other team purposely
It doesn't happen all the time, only when teams are uneven

replies.body:
I understand what you mean.

I think you should be able to rejoin the same game on another team as long as you return to the hub first. 

The reason I say that players should still be able to do this is because(in my opinion) it does not really matter which team you are on as long as you are having a good time. Players would have to return to hub so that other players who are not upgraded can still have a chance to join the game when there are only a few spots left than not being able to join a full team when like five players are doing /join to rejoin the game on another team without exiting the game.
replies.body_tagged:

Players would have to return to hub so that other players who are not upgraded can still have a chance to join the game when there are only a few spots left than not being able to join a full team when like five players are doing /join to rejoin the game on another team without exiting the game.

replies.body: You can also do /leave and then wait till the other team has less players than the other and do /join again. That's what I did as I was a non donor.
replies.body_tagged: You can also do /leave and then wait till the other team has less players than the other and do /join again. That's what I did as I was a non donor.
